answers.answer: I'm curious to know why you feel your back pain is related to diabetes? This like having a toothache and seeing a foot doctor. All kidding aside, you have Sciatic nerve issues usually caused by a bulging disc pushing against a sciatic nerve. A good Chiropractor within 2-3 visits can realign your lumbars and alleviate the pain non-evasively, or you can opt out for spinal cord surgery, a disectomy of the disc.
See an orthopaedist for an evaluation and go from there.

question: for over three weeks i have been suffering serious pains at my lower back and upper buttocks, when amm lying down, leaning forward, sitting and geting up..even when i sneeze, cough and bend my neck. i saw a doctor all he did was to tell me it was spasm and gave me some drugs but no improvement since then. am really scared.
title: serious lower back pain
